titles.title: To amend the Military Selective Service Act to provide that a registrant for selective service may indicate at the time of registration a desire to be classified as a conscientious objector.
To amend the Military Selective Service Act to provide that a registrant for selective service may indicate at the time of registration a desire to be classified as a conscientious objector.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: This bill amends the Military Selective Service Act to allow a registrant for selective service to indicate at the time of registration a desire to be classified as a conscientious objector and to submit a written statement in support of such classification.
